intro: Lobostemon paniculiformis, commonly known as the panicle lobostemon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, branched inflorescences. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, tubular flowers in shades of purple and white. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
